jobs.title: Senior Software Robotics Engineer - Full Stack & Vision
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us

Reframe Systems is on a mission to build fast, cost-efficient, and climate-resilient homes for everyone. Through our modular building platform and highly automated production process, we reduce costs, shorten delivery times, and lower embodied carbon for housing projects of all sizes—from single-family homes to large multifamily developments. Our first software-driven factory in the greater Boston area (Andover, MA) is just the beginning of our national expansion. Backed by leading venture capital firms in the industrial and construction sectors, we are transforming how homes are built.

What We're Looking For

We’re seeking a Full Stack Software Engineer with a focus on robotic perception, computer vision, and machine learning to help create the automation systems that power our next-generation micro-factory. You will work closely with a multi-disciplinary team of roboticists, architects, and engineers to design, prototype, and deploy a new class of manipulation workcells. This is a unique opportunity to shape the future of software-defined automation for industrialized construction.

Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, and maintain full-stack production code for robotic manipulation workcells in a fast-paced environment.

  • Lead architecture decisions for ML perception systems, guiding initial prototyping, pipeline development, model training, and automated testing.

  • Validate hypotheses via data-driven experimentation and prototyping; document, share, and champion findings within the team.

  • Carry new ideas from proof-of-concept to operational deployment in real-world manufacturing settings.

  • Collaborate on the design of robotic components that form the foundation for next-generation automated micro-factories.

Basic Qualifications

  • 5+ years of experience in software development, robotics, or machine vision.

  • Advanced skills with C++17 and Python, particularly in a Linux environment using ROS 2.

  • Proficiency in professional engineering best practices (Git, code reviews, coding standards, CI/CD, testing).

  • Experience applying state-of-the-art ML tools to solve robotics perception problems.

  • Demonstrated success delivering reliable, production-ready systems at scale.

  • Effective communicator who thrives in a collaborative, diverse team environment.

  • Able to work independently, take initiative, and solve complex technical problems.

Bonus

  • Experience deploying or maintaining ML systems at scale, including data-collection and retraining pipelines.

  • Familiarity with open-source libraries in our robotics stack (Tesseract, BehaviorTree.Cpp, Foxglove, OpenCV, PCL, GTest/GMock).

  • Familiarity with Docker, AWS, or VSCode in a development environment.

  • Preferred BS/MS in Robotics, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Math, or a related STEM field.

If you don’t meet every qualification but are excited about our mission, we still encourage you to apply. We value diverse skills and perspectives.

jobs.title: Sales Operations Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Reframe Systems: Reframe Systems is on a mission to build resilient housing for all, at massive scale. To achieve our mission, we need to make low-carbon carbon housing more affordable by re-imagining how housing is designed and built. Our volumetric module platform and agile production system will drive down cost, delivery time, and embodied carbon for multifamily housing. With our first software-driven microfactory in the greater Boston area (Andover, MA), we are on a roadmap to scale our presence nationally. We are disrupting assembly line manufacturing for housing production and are backed by leading VC firms in the industrial and construction space.

The Role – Wear Many Hats & Build Our Sales Engine: This isn't your typical Sales Ops role. As our Sales Operations Manager at Reframe Systems, you’ll be a pivotal, hands-on leader, shaping our sales engine as we scale. You'll wear many hats – from strategic process design to tactical CRM administration, from data guru to sales team enabler. We need a proactive builder who thrives in a dynamic startup environment, comfortable with ambiguity, and is ready to tackle diverse challenges to drive revenue growth for our geographically dispersed sales team.

Location: Based in Greater Boston or Greater Los Angeles area (Supporting teams in New England & Los Angeles with travel between locations once a quarter or as needed).

The position reports to the Head of Product and Commercialization.  The position is full-time, salaried. 

What You'll Do :

  • Build & Optimize: Design, implement, and continuously refine our end-to-end sales processes, CRM infrastructure, and sales technology stack.

  • Data & Insights: Own sales data integrity, develop insightful reports and dashboards, manage forecasting, and turn analytics into actionable strategies. Own the CRM system to produce reliable, consistent, and meaningful reporting.

  • Bridge to Inbound Opportunities: Collaborate with the strategy team on lead development and screen and score all inbound leads. 

  • Enable & Support: Equip our growing, bi-coastal sales team with the documentation, tools, and consistent support they need to succeed.

  • Collaborate & Coordinate: Act as the central hub, liaising across sales, marketing, design, operations, and leadership to ensure alignment and smooth execution.

  • Problem Solve & Adapt: Tackle a wide range of operational challenges, adapt strategies to different market dynamics (New England vs. LA), and contribute to pricing and contract processes.

What You Bring :

  • Proven Sales Ops Expertise: Demonstrated success in a Sales Operations role, ideally building systems in a startup or high-growth tech environment.

  • CRM & Tech Savvy: Deep experience with CRM systems, a firm grasp of sales automation tools. Experience with and interest in AI-driven sales tools.

  • Analytical & Process-Oriented: Excellent data analysis, reporting, forecasting, and process optimization skills. You see the big picture and the details. Experience with modern data analysis tools is a plus (Tableau, Power BI, Python/pandas, SQL or similar)

  • Ultimate Team Player: Strong communication, collaboration, and training abilities. You can motivate and guide a distributed team.

  • "Get-it-Done" Attitude: Highly organized, proactive, adaptable, resilient, and a natural problem-solver. You take initiative and thrive on making things happen.

  • Business Acumen: Good understanding of sales funnels, physical product sales cycles, and business drivers in real estate development or construction-related fields.

  • Education: A Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Finance, Information Technology, or a related field is required. 

Why Join Reframe Systems?

  • Impact: Play a foundational role in a company disrupting the housing industry.

  • Build: Create and own the sales operations function with significant autonomy.

  • Growth: Join a dynamic, innovative team with ample opportunities for professional development.

Reframe Systems is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status.

jobs.title: Production Supervisor - Prefab Construction
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Reframe Systems

Reframe Systems is on a mission to solve the housing and climate crises by building low-carbon, high-performance, and affordable homes for all. We are a “Modular 3.0” company, applying lessons from Amazon’s software-driven logistics to develop an entirely new, industrialized approach to construction. Our agile, low-CAPEX microfactories, software-driven manufacturing platform, and human-augmentation technology enable us to build beautiful homes with unrivaled speed, quality, and cost-efficiency.

With a recently closed Series A investment round and a 2026 production schedule that is already fully booked, we are scaling rapidly. We are seeking a hands-on, detail-oriented Production Supervisor to lead daily operations on our factory floor and ensure our teams hit throughput, quality, and safety goals.

The Role

As a Production Supervisor, you will be responsible for managing a crew of builders and leading daily execution across our Andover microfactory. You will translate production plans into action, allocate labor across stations, and make sure work is completed safely, efficiently, and to specification.

This is a role for someone who thrives on the factory floor, leads by example, and takes pride in developing teams. You will be the key link between builders and leadership—keeping work moving, escalating blockers, and instilling a culture of accountability and craftsmanship.

Responsibilities

  • Lead day-to-day production activities across assigned areas (e.g., framing, panel assembly, finishes).

  • Execute the daily schedule, assign tasks, and monitor progress to ensure milestones are hit.

  • Provide hands-on leadership—stepping in to work alongside the crew when needed.

  • Coach and develop builders, giving feedback and driving accountability for quality and productivity.

  • Enforce strict safety and quality standards; conduct daily safety checks and inspections.

  • Collaborate with the Director of Factory Operations on labor planning, workflow adjustments, and problem-solving.

  • Identify issues on the floor and partner with engineering and process teams to drive improvements.

  • Track and report key floor metrics (attendance, productivity, rework, scrap).

  • Support onboarding and training of new builders, reinforcing Reframe’s culture and standards.

  • Ensure the factory is organized, stocked, and ready for efficient production.

Who You Are

  • 3–5+ years of construction or manufacturing experience, ideally in residential, modular, or panelized building.

  • At least 1–2 years in a lead or supervisory role, managing crews on a shop floor or jobsite.

  • Strong knowledge of carpentry and general construction methods.

  • Hands-on leader—able to both direct work and jump in as needed.

  • Excellent communicator who sets clear expectations and follows through.

  • Practical understanding of lean manufacturing or continuous improvement a plus.

  • Technology-forward: comfortable using tablets and production apps.

  • High integrity, dependable, and mission-driven.

Why Join Us

At Reframe, you’ll join a mission-driven company reshaping how homes are built. As Production Supervisor, you’ll play a pivotal role in scaling our factory operations, developing our teams, and setting the standard for how we deliver net-zero housing at speed and scale.

jobs.title: Manufacturing Engineer - Microfactory Intern Summer 2026
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us

Reframe Systems is on a mission to build net-zero carbon housing for all, at massive scale. To achieve our mission, we need to make net-zero carbon housing more affordable and we are re-imagining how housing is designed and built. Our modular building platform and highly-automated production system will drive down cost, delivery time, and embodied carbon for ADUs and multifamily housing. We are setting up our first software driven factory in the greater Boston area (Andover, MA), and have a roadmap to scale our presence nationally. We are disrupting assembly line manufacturing for housing production and are backed by leading VC firms in the industrial and construction space.

What We're Looking For

We are looking for a manufacturing engineer intern or co-op to help us design and build a re-imagined, carbon conscious, highly-automated, offsite construction micro-factory. The ideal candidate has passion for mechanical, electrical, and/or instrumentation/programming projects as a means to solve real-world problems. Candidates with prior experience in robotics, manufacturing, and home construction environments are preferred (academic or otherwise), and all candidates with engineering experience and a passion to learn will be considered. Candidates should be eager to collaborate with a multi-disciplinary team of industry-veteran roboticists, hardware and software engineers, home builders, and architects to tackle hard-problems designing, prototyping, and testing projects within our Andover factory and the associated work cells and processes.

Responsibilities

  • Contribute to the design, procurement, construction, and implementation of factory projects in the Andover microfactory. Work alongside senior engineers in working on large factory improvement projects, and gain exposure in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.

  • Collaborate in the design of factory documentation, factory layouts, and factory concepts, and also collaborate in research on novel construction processes and automated work cell concepts

  • Assist in creating and driving data-driven experiments. Document and summarize findings, presenting them to the team for collaborative discussion. Create new models for calculating factory performance in both individual areas and across the whole area.


Basic Qualifications

  • Currently pursuing a degree in Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Robotics, or a related STEM discipline

  • Previous experience in manufacturing engineering, construction engineering, or in factory environments is a plus

  • Skills in CAD Software, such as Solidworks, AutoCAD, or modeling software like OnShape or CATIA are a plus

  • Self-motivated with the ability to independently solve problems. Strong communication skills and the capacity to collaborate effectively within a team.

  • Strong passion for automation, the build environment, and improving processes is highly valued

jobs.title: Construction Supervisor (MA CSL)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us

At Reframe Systems, we're on a mission to make net-zero carbon housing more accessible and affordable for everyone. We're rethinking how housing is designed and built by manufacturing beautiful, high-performance module boxes in our Andover, MA factory. These modules are then delivered to jobsites and assembled into custom homes. Designed by our in-house architects, framed by our robotic framing arm, and finished by our skilled carpenters, our process is a unique blend of innovation and craftsmanship. We have a clear roadmap to scale our presence across the country, and you'll be a key part of that growth.

What We're Looking For

We are seeking a Construction Supervisor with strong carpentry skills to manage our site work, home delivery, and finishing. This is a great opportunity for a hands-on supervisor who is excited to work with both traditional building methods and our innovative modular construction process.

  • Must have an active Unrestricted Construction Supervisor License (CSL) in Massachusetts.

  • Multifamily residential experience is preferred, but extensive ground-up residential home construction of any type will be considered.

Responsibilities

  • Subcontractor Management: You will be the primary point of contact on the jobsite, responsible for all subcontractors from the first shovel to the client move-in. This includes coordinating surveys, excavation, site utilities, foundation, cranes, rigging, carpentry, and final finishes.

  • Employee Management & Training: Lead and train our company carpenters, providing daily work lists and guidance to ensure quality and productivity.

  • Jobsite Safety: You are the designated Jobsite Safety Officer, responsible for maintaining a safe working environment for all personnel and visitors.

  • Project Coordination & Communication: Maintain clear and helpful communication with all stakeholders, including clients, inspectors, subcontractors, and neighbors.

  • Daily Documentation: Maintain a detailed daily log with photos and notes to ensure clear communication and a complete project record.

  • Scheduling & Planning: Partner with the Project Manager to maintain a four-week lookahead schedule for materials, labor, and logistics.

  • Quality Control: With the support of our entire team, you will be responsible for delivering a finished, high-quality product to the customer.

  • Risk Management & Project Closeout: Identify potential project risks and support closeout activities, including punch lists and warranty documentation.

  • Licensing & Inspections: As the license holder, you will be asked to apply for permits and coordinate, prepare for, and manage all site inspections with municipalities.

Qualifications

  • 5+ years of experience in ground-up residential construction.

  • Deep knowledge of building means and methods.

  • Proficiency in using construction apps like Procore or Buildertrend.

  • Active MA Unrestricted CSL.

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

  • Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment with multiple trades working at once.

  • Ability to collaborate effectively with our in-house design and factory teams.

  • Physically able to lift 50 lbs.

  • Valid driver's license and reliable transportation.

Work Details

  • Location: Projects are currently in Somerville and Devens.

  • Schedule: 7am start time, Monday-Friday.

  • Reporting: When not on a jobsite, you will report to our Andover, MA factory.

Benefits

  • Generous vacation policy.

  • Medical, dental, vision, life insurance, 401k, and pet insurance.

To Apply

Interested candidates are encouraged to submit their resume.

We are looking to transform the AEC design process to support our novel production system. This means creating designs that are far more detailed than traditional AEC workflows dictate, augmenting CAD workflows with advanced scripting and automated design logic, and generating many supporting assets to aid manufacturing and analysis. We are looking for a problem-solving self-starter who likes a challenge and thrives in a multidisciplinary environment.

We are seeking a talented and detail-oriented Computer-Aided Design (CAD) Modeler to join our dynamic architectural, engineering, and construction (AEC) team. The CAD Modeler will play a crucial role in transforming conceptual designs for residential and low-rise mulit-family buildings into precise, detailed 3D models. This role requires a strong command in mechanical CAD software such as Catia, Creo, Onshape or Solidworks, with deep working knowledge of creating and updating models; a keen eye for accuracy; and a deep understanding of 3D model management. Ideally, the candidate has worked with the scripting capabilities of their CAD system and has a developed understanding of the challenges of automating design.

The CAD modeler will work closely with architects, designers, and engineers in a collaborative and creative work environment.

The position reports to the Head of Building Products. The position is full-time, salaried, exempt.

Responsibilities

  • CAD Modeling and Detailing: Create detailed 3D CAD models using world-class mechanical parametric CAD systems. Collaborate with architects and designers to convert design concepts into high-fidelity 3D CAD models.

  • CAD Management: Organize and maintain 3D models, files and documentation, including revisions, ensuring that the latest versions are readily accessible to team members. Manage and update CAD models, families, and templates.

  • Model Coordination: Work closely with other CAD modelers (external partners) to coordinate on the CAD models, perform clash detection, and ensure effective change management.

  • Quality Assurance: Review 3D models for accuracy, completeness, and compliance with project standards and regulations. Make revisions as necessary to address design changes or discrepancies.

  • Manufacturing Drawing Preparation: Work with other CAD modelers (external partners) to generate 3D details of structural, MEPF and other systems, ensuring compliance with building codes and regulations.

  • Collaboration: Collaborate effectively with other CAD modelers, architects, project managers, and other team members to meet project deadlines and objectives.

Basic Qualifications

  • Minimum 3-5 years of experience as a CAD Modeler is required for this role. Bachelor's degree in an engineering field is required. Background in the construction industry is a plus.

  • Proficiency in CATIA, Onshape, or Solidworks to create, manage, and update 3D CAD models. Knowledge of Autodesk Inventor and Revit is a strong plus.

  • Prior experience in CAD modeling is required.

  • Ability to quickly pick up a wide variety of CAD software plugins.

  • Excellent attention to detail and the ability to produce accurate and precise 3D models.

  • Effective communication skills and the ability to work well in a team.

  • Problem-solving skills and the ability to adapt to changing project requirements.


Please include a portfolio of works highlighting key projects where your CAD Modeler role included model management, CAD modeling, and detailing.

We are seeking a Licensed Plumber (Class 2) to join our team and play a critical role across both factory and field operations. Responsibilities

  • Perform plumbing installations in modular housing units, including water supply lines, drainage systems, and gas piping.

  • Contribute to the development of shop drawings and ensure alignment with Massachusetts Plumbing Code.

  • Collaborate with production teams, field crews, and other trades to complete projects on time and with precision.

  • Supervise and mentor apprentices, providing guidance and fostering skill development.

  • Ensure all plumbing work adheres to Massachusetts Plumbing Code and Reframe Systems’ standards.

  • Conduct quality checks to verify system integrity and functionality.

  • Maintain a clean and organized workspace, following all safety protocols.

  • Diagnose and resolve plumbing issues in both factory and field environments.

  • Communicate effectively with supervisors to address challenges and propose solutions.

Basic Qualifications

  • 3+ years of experience as a licensed plumber, preferably in manufacturing, modular construction, or commercial/residential projects.

  • Strong knowledge of plumbing codes and standards, particularly the Massachusetts Plumbing Code.

  • Proficiency in plumbing tools, equipment, and testing devices.

  • Experience reading and interpreting blueprints, diagrams, and digital plans.

  • Physical ability to lift up to 50 pounds, work overhead, and perform tasks requiring manual dexterity.

  • Excellent communication and problem-solving skills.

At Reframe Systems, you’ll be part of an innovative, mission-driven team transforming housing construction. Your work will directly contribute to delivering sustainable, net-zero modular housing at scale, addressing critical challenges in housing and climate. We value craftsmanship, teamwork, and your professional growth.

Reframe Systems is on a mission to build resilient, energy efficient housing at a massive scale, by re-imagining how housing is designed and built. In this role, you will play a crucial part in managing volumetric modular projects from conception through to completion, with support and collaboration from your fellow architects, Platform, Process Engineering, DFMA and site delivery teams. This includes working on a project's full lifecycle, from the initial design phase to its final installation on site. You'll be responsible for coordinating with various project consultants, including but not limited to Structural, Civil, Energy, FP, and MEP.

The ideal candidate is proactive, collaborative and tech-forward. This role requires a strong command of relevant codes and Revit expertise. We are looking for someone with 7-10 years of architectural experience across the entire project life cycle, preferably focused on residential and low-rise multi-family buildings in the US.

This position is full-time, salaried, and exempt.

This position is in person, on site at our Andover, MA factory.

What We Value

  • Tech-Forward Mentality: You are excited to embrace and help implement new technologies and tools. We work primarily in Revit, and are actively designing our workflows from Revit concept to factory floor reality.

  • Strong Collaboration Skills: You work effectively and communicate clearly with a diverse group of internal and external teams, including consultants, DFMA, Design Engineering, and on-site crews.

  • Learning Mindset: With a passion for continuous learning, you are willing to adapt to new methods and challenges in a rapidly evolving industry.

Responsibilities

  • Project Management: Work on and manage active volumetric modular projects from beginning to end, ensuring all project goals are met.

  • Consultant Coordination: Serve as the primary point of contact for external consultants, including structural, mechanical, electrical, and plumbing engineers, managing their contributions and integrating their designs into the overall project.

  • Team Collaboration: Coordinate closely with our internal teams to ensure designs are optimized for manufacturing, and with our site delivery teams to ensure seamless installation and button up.

  • Design and Documentation: Oversee the creation of detailed designs, architectural drawings, plans, sections, and elevations, ensuring all documentation is accurate, complete, and compliant with project standards and regulations.

  • Code Compliance: Maintain a current understanding of all relevant building codes and regulations to ensure project plans meet legal requirements. Experience with rating systems such as Passive House and/or LEED is a plus.

  • Permit Submission and Tracking: Track project deliverables to the relevant AHJ and modular review authorities.

  • Quality Assurance: Review and approve all architectural drawings and documents, making revisions as necessary to address design changes or discrepancies.

Qualifications

  • A Bachelor of Architecture (BArch) degree is required. A Master of Architecture (MArch) is strongly preferred. Licensure or pathway to licensure in MA is a plus.

  • 7-10 years of experience in architectural design and execution.

  • Proven experience working on and managing architectural design projects from beginning to end.

  • Experience managing and coordinating external consultant work, including schedules and design detail coordination.

  • Strong understanding of architectural principles, building materials, and construction methods. Modular or factory-based construction experience is a bonus.

  • Expertise in architectural drafting and 3D modeling (Revit).

  • In-depth knowledge of residential and multi-family building codes and regulations.

  • Strong communication and problem-solving skills.

Additional Information

The Project Architect will work closely with architects, designers, and engineers in a collaborative and creative work environment. Reframe offers ample opportunity to grow in your career, and we are committed to helping our team members reach their full potential. Salary commensurate with experience.

Please include a portfolio of your work highlighting key design projects.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement

Reframe Systems is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and applicants. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply.

jobs.title: Product Manager - Microfactory as a Product
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Reframe

Reframe Systems is on a mission to deliver fast, cost-efficient, and climate-resilient homes for everyone. Our modular building platform and software-defined microfactories reduce costs, shorten delivery timelines, and lower embodied carbon across all types of housing—from single-family homes to large multifamily developments. Our first digital factory, located in Andover, MA, is just the beginning of our national expansion. Backed by top-tier venture capital firms, we’re reimagining how housing gets built.

What We’re Looking For

We are seeking a Product Manager to lead the development of the systems that power our microfactory, from workcell automation and robotics to factory orchestration and operations software. This role is deeply cross-functional: you’ll collaborate with manufacturing engineers, software developers, roboticists, operators, and business leaders to define the “what” and the “why” across our manufacturing technology stack.

You will own the roadmap for factory execution and automation products, guiding features from idea through implementation and iteration. This is a rare opportunity to shape the core tooling behind our end-to-end industrialized construction process, and to do it in a highly dynamic, real-world production environment.

Responsibilities

  • Own Product Strategy for the Microfactory Stack: Define and evolve the vision, strategy, and priorities for Reframe’s factory software and automation systems, including factory orchestration tools, robotic workcells, and operator interfaces.

  • Lead User-Centered Discovery: Work directly with operators, automation engineers, and factory leaders to identify pain points, gather feedback, and uncover high-leverage opportunities for product improvement.

  • Translate Ambiguity into Roadmaps: Break down complex operational or technical needs into clearly scoped initiatives and user stories. Manage backlog and roadmap across multiple product surfaces.

  • Drive Cross-Functional Execution: Collaborate with software, robotics, and manufacturing teams to ensure solutions are technically feasible, delivered on time, and aligned with user needs.

  • Measure and Improve Impact: Define success metrics for new features, track adoption, and drive iterative improvement based on real-time usage data and frontline feedback.

  • Act as Internal Product Evangelist: Communicate product vision, trade-offs, and status across the company—from floor operators to executive leadership.

Qualifications

  • 3+ years of experience as a Product Manager in a complex technical environment (e.g., manufacturing systems, robotics, factory software, or hardware/software integration)

  • Demonstrated experience working cross-functionally with engineering, operations, and design teams in fast-paced or ambiguous environments

  • Familiarity with agile product development practices, including writing user stories, backlog management, and sprint planning

  • Strong systems thinker with ability to prioritize across short-term factory needs and long-term product scalability

  • Clear, concise communicator able to bridge business, operations, and engineering

  • Passion for manufacturing, advanced robotics, or industrial automation

  • Bonus: Experience in the AEC or construction tech industries

This Role Is For You If…

  • You’ve been embedded in or adjacent to a factory, R&D lab, or robotics program and enjoy translating messy realities into elegant tooling

  • You thrive in high-ambiguity, high-ownership environments

  • You’re equally energized by walking a production line and debating UX tradeoffs for internal tools

  • You believe product excellence can drive real-world impact, faster, cheaper, and greener housing

We are seeking an experienced and passionate Senior FeatureScript Developer to join our Design Automation (DA) team. This team is at the core of our mission, building the essential software tools that bridge the gap between design and manufacturing. The ideal candidate has a deep understanding of Onshape and FeatureScript, a knack for solving complex geometric problems, and a passion for creating robust, user-friendly automation tools. You will work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment, directly with our Design Engineering (DE), Manufacturing and Operations, and Architecture teams to understand their challenges and build the solutions that will define the future of industrialized construction. This is a unique opportunity to have a massive impact on how we design and build homes.

Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, and maintain production-level FeatureScript applications within the Onshape platform to automate the design of our building components.

  • Collaborate closely with internal customer teams to understand their workflows, identify pain points, and translate their needs into well-defined technical requirements and user stories.

  • Drive the architecture and implementation of new FeatureScript tools for panelization, MEP routing, BOM generation, and other critical aspects of our CAD-to-fabrication pipeline.

  • Debug and resolve issues with existing FeatureScript tools, ensuring their stability and reliability for the DE team.

  • Contribute to the long-term vision and roadmap for the Design Automation team, helping to shape the future of our software-defined manufacturing processes.

  • Validate hypotheses through data-driven experimentation and prototyping, and effectively document and communicate your findings to a highly interdisciplinary team.

  • Mentor junior developers and contribute to a culture of innovation, quality, and continuous improvement within the technology group.

Qualifications

  • 5-7 years of professional software development experience, with a strong focus on 3D CAD and parametric modeling.

  • Demonstrated expertise in Onshape and FeatureScript, with a portfolio of projects showcasing your ability to create complex and robust automation tools.

  • Excellent software development skills in modern programming languages such as Python, C++, or TypeScript.

  • Deep understanding of 3D geometry, topology, and coordinate systems.

  • Proven ability to work collaboratively with users and stakeholders to gather requirements, design solutions, and deliver software that meets their needs.

  • Proficiency in professional engineering best practices, including code reviews, source control (Git), CI/CD, and testing.

  • Strong communication skills and the ability to work effectively in a team environment.

  • BS/MS in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or a related STEM field.

Bonus

  • Experience in delivering software systems that orchestrate workflows across software, human, and machine systems, such as in automated factories.

  • Experience with the Onshape API and developing external applications that interact with Onshape.

  • Familiarity with the AEC (Architecture, Engineering, and Construction) industry and building information modeling (BIM).

  • Experience with cloud-native architecture and distributed systems.

jobs.title: Senior Technical Lead, Special Projects (Automation & Augmentation)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us

Reframe Systems is on a mission to build fast, cost-efficient, and climate-resilient homes for everyone. Through our modular building platform and highly automated production process, we reduce costs, shorten delivery times, and lower embodied carbon for housing projects of all sizes—from single-family homes to large multifamily developments. Our first software-driven factory in the greater Boston area (Andover, MA) is just the beginning of our national expansion. Backed by leading venture capital firms in the industrial and construction sectors, we are transforming how homes are built.


What We're Looking For

Reframe is seeking a Senior Technical Lead, Special Projects (Automation & Augmentation) to design and deliver novel systems that blend mechatronics with software-driven intelligence. This role is about more than controls,it’s about augmenting human operators with tools that make the factory smarter, faster, and more reliable. You’ll build solutions that leverage projection and printing for floor guidance, vision for real-time quality assurance, UWB for localization, and AI to optimize workflows. Perfect for a hands-on leader who thrives in ambiguity and wants to push the boundaries of how software and hardware combine on the factory floor.

What You’ll Do

  • Design and deploy special projects that augment operators using projection, inkjet, and digital interfaces to drive intent on the factory floor.

  • Integrate advanced sensing systems, including vision for quality inspection, UWB for localization, and real-time feedback loops.

  • Build electromechanical subsystems—fixtures, robotic tools, material-handling devices—that connect seamlessly with software-first interfaces.

  • Develop and prototype AI- and data-driven solutions to optimize throughput, reduce errors, and simplify decision-making.

  • Lead scrappy prototyping and iterative testing, rapidly moving from concept to production-ready systems.

  • Collaborate with software, manufacturing, and mechanical teams to deliver solutions that combine code, sensors, and machines into cohesive workflows.

  • Document technical learnings and establish reusable patterns for software-driven augmentation across future factories.

What We’re Looking For

  • Proven experience leading projects at the intersection of robotics, mechatronics, and software-driven automation.

  • Hands-on skills with mechanical design, motion systems, and electromechanical integration.

  • Strong software skills (Python, C++, ROS, vision frameworks, industrial APIs) for building interfaces, controls, and intelligent automation.

  • Experience with sensing technologies: vision, UWB localization, projection, or similar operator-augmentation tools.

  • Demonstrated ability to take ideas from prototype to production in a factory or high-stakes environment.

  • High agency, problem-solving mindset, and comfort working in ambiguous problem spaces.

  • Bonus: experience applying AI/ML for quality, workflow optimization, or predictive automation.

If you don’t meet every qualification but are excited about our mission, we still encourage you to apply. We value diverse skills and perspectives.

HVAC Installer
We're looking for a highly motivated HVAC Installer to join our team. This is a great opportunity to learn on the job and build a career in a growing industry. You'll work on our innovative modular homes, helping us install and test all-electric HVAC systems, including heat pumps, ERVs (Energy Recovery Ventilators), and the related ductwork.

  • Help our experienced team install and mount heat pumps, including the refrigerant lines.

  • Learn how to assemble and install ductwork, ensuring it's sealed correctly for optimal airflow.

  • Help inspect completed work to ensure it meets our quality standards.

  • Work alongside licensed plumbers and electricians as we build our homes.

  • Some basic experience with HVAC systems is a plus, but not required.

  • A strong desire to learn, an eye for detail, and a positive attitude.

Why Join Our Team?
This is a hands-on role where you'll gain valuable experience and grow your skills. You'll be part of a team building a new kind of housing that is sustainable and affordable. We're committed to your professional development and we'll provide mentorship and training to help you succeed

Reframe Systems is on a mission to deliver net-zero carbon housing at scale. Our first software-driven factory in Andover, MA is pioneering a new approach to modular housing—combining advanced manufacturing with sustainable design.

Role Overview

We’re looking for an entry level Carpenter to join our growing team. This role focuses on building and assembling modular housing components—ranging from framing and sheathing to installation of doors, windows, and structural elements. You’ll contribute to both factory production and on-site assembly, ensuring our homes are strong, accurate, and built to last.

Responsibilities

  • Perform carpentry tasks in a controlled factory setting and on residential job sites.

  • Frame and assemble wall, floor, and roof components using standardized methods.

  • Assist to install doors, windows, subfloors, sheathing, and other structural or enclosure elements.

  • Collaborate with team members to ensure assemblies are accurate, consistent, and ready for follow-on trades.

  • Interpret shop and construction drawings to guide accurate builds and installations.

  • Operate saws, nailers, routers, and other woodworking tools safely and efficiently.

  • Conduct quality checks to ensure assemblies meet company standards.

  • Maintain clean, organized workspaces and follow all safety procedures.

Qualifications

  • High school diploma or equivalent.

  • 1+ years of carpentry experience a plus.

  • Experience in framing, sheathing, and installation of windows, doors, and related assemblies a plus.

  • Comfortable reading drawings and measuring to tight tolerances.

  • Proficient with hand tools, power tools, and precision measuring instruments.

  • Ability to lift up to 50 lbs and work in overhead positions for extended periods.

  • Strong attention to detail and commitment to craftsmanship.

  • Team-oriented and adaptable in a fast-paced environment.

Working Conditions

  • Primary work location: Reframe’s factory in Andover, MA.

  • Physical demands include standing, lifting, bending, and handling materials/tools.

  • Some overtime or weekend work may be required to meet production schedules.

Why Reframe?

Join a company reshaping the future of housing. At Reframe, you’ll be part of an innovative, mission-driven team building sustainable homes with precision and purpose.

jobs.title: Senior Design Engineer - CAD to Fab for Modular Housing
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us

Reframe Systems is on a mission to build net-zero carbon housing for all, at massive scale. To achieve our mission, we need to make net-zero carbon housing more affordable and we are re-imagining how housing is designed and built. Our volumetric module platform and highly-automated production system will drive down cost, delivery time, and embodied carbon for multifamily housing. We are setting up our first digital factory in the greater Boston area (Andover, MA), and have a roadmap to scale our presence nationally. We are disrupting assembly line manufacturing for housing production and are backed by leading VC firms in the industrial and construction space.

What We're Looking For

We are seeking a highly talented, detail-oriented, and experienced Senior Mechanical Engineer to join our dynamic and multidisciplinary AEC team. This role is crucial for transforming the traditional design process by developing and implementing advanced parameterized designs and automated design logic for residential and low-rise multi-family buildings.

The right candidate will serve as a technical leader, bridging the gap between design ideation and final fabrication. You will leverage deep expertise in parametric CAD and scripting to create designs that are far more detailed than traditional AEC workflows, generate manufacturing-ready assets, and ultimately drive efficiency and precision across our product line. The ideal candidate will thrive in a fast-paced environment and be comfortable owning the end-to-end design to manufacturing process.

The position reports to the Design Engineering Team Lead. The position is full-time, salaried, exempt and in-person.

Key Responsibilities

As a Senior Mechanical Engineer, you will be responsible for the following areas, with an emphasis on automation and process improvement:

  • Expert CAD Modeling and Detailing: Serve as the technical authority for creating detailed and parametrized CAD models using Onshape. Collaborate with the architecture and manufacturing teams to convert high-level concepts into robust, fabrication-ready digital models with a high level of accuracy and a deep understanding of tolerance stackup.

  • Advanced CAD version Management: Establish, organize, and maintain best practices for 3D model management, file structure, documentation and revision control, ensuring models are seamlessly integrated into the fabrication pipeline.

  • Cross-Functional Collaboration: Act as a critical technical interface, collaborating effectively with manufacturing, operations, architecture, and software teams to resolve design challenges and meet critical product development deadlines.

  • Conceptualization & Ideation: Lead the generation of mechanical concepts, feasibility studies for standardized and parametric assemblies, and initial architecture development based on product requirements, collaborating closely with product management and industrial design teams.

  • Prototyping & Testing: Design, build, and iterate on functional prototypes; develop and execute rigorous testing plans (e.g., DVT - Design Verification Testing) to validate mechanical performance, durability, and compliance with specifications.

Outcomes

  • Developed parametric subassemblies that can be re-used across multiple projects.

  • Demonstrated reduction in modeling cost/sqft for new projects and cost/sqft for modifications to existing products.

  • Elevated design quality assurance by establishing clear modeling best practices and implementing a structured, targeted design review protocol. This ensured reviewers focused on high-value, critical aspects, leading to faster approvals and fewer iterative cycles.

Required Qualifications

  • 5+ years of progressive experience as a Mechanical Engineer or a similar role focused on detailed product design, preferably within the AEC, high-tech manufacturing, or related construction industries.

  • Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering, Manufacturing Engineering, Architecture or a closely related technical field.

  • Expert-level proficiency in a major parametric CAD system (e.g., Onshape, SolidWorks, CATIA).

  • Demonstrated experience with the management of large-scale, complex 3D assemblies and data management.

  • Proven ability to proactively identify, diagnose, and solve complex, multidisciplinary engineering problems.

  • Exceptional attention to detail and a commitment to producing accurate, precise, and manufacturing-ready models and documentation.

  • Ability to mentor junior team members on best practices in modeling and documentation.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Direct experience developing design automation and scripting capabilities (e.g. FeatureScript, Python, visual programming like Grasshopper/Dynamo).

  • Familiarity with the challenges and workflows associated with modular construction or off-site manufacturing.

  • Proficiency in additional software packages such as Autodesk Inventor and/or BIM platforms like Revit.

  • Knowledge in structural, MEPF and other building systems, ensuring strict compliance with all relevant building codes and regulations.

Please include a portfolio of works highlighting key CAD projects.
